page.title: 11Farming
page.content: Skirlaugh stands on fertile alluvial soil which is excellent for arable and mixed farming. Our land cover survey shows that the area around the village is mainly used for growing crops such as grain, oil seed rape and vegetables. Some animals are kept, especially pigs and there are supposed to be more pigs than people in the area. Most animals are reared in indoor units but a few cows and horses can be seen sometimes. About a hundred years ago nearly everybody in the village would probably have worked on a farm, now hardly any do as so many jobs are done by machines. Many farms to day are made up of several smaller farms and many of the hedges and fences have been taken down to make it easier to use machinery.
